userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: k

condition.description:
Breast cancer affects one in eight women during their lives. Breast cancer kills more women in the United States than any cancer except lung cancer. No one knows why some women get breast cancer, but there are a number of risk factors. Risks that you cannot change include

  • Age - the chance of getting breast cancer rises as a woman gets older
  • Genes - there are two genes, BRCA1 and BRCA2, that greatly increase the risk. Women who have family members with breast or ovarian cancer may wish to be tested.
  • Personal factors - beginning periods before age 12 or going through menopause after age 55

Other risks include being overweight, using hormone replacement therapy (also called menopausal hormone therapy), taking birth control pills, drinking alcohol, not having children or having your first child after age 35 or having dense breasts.

Symptoms of breast cancer may include a lump in the breast, a change in size or shape of the breast or discharge from a nipple. Breast self-exam and mammography can help find breast cancer early when it is most treatable. Treatment may consist of radiation, lumpectomy, mastectomy, chemotherapy and hormone therapy.

Men can have breast cancer, too, but the number of cases is small.

NIH: National Cancer Institute
condition.name: Breast cancer
symptoms: A change in the size or shape of your breast

userStories.identifier: Fitness person who goes to the gym daily
userStories.tip: I developed painful trigger fingers and thumbs, plus De Quervain's tenosynovitis (like carpal tunnel except in the inner side tendon) in both wrists.  My feet hurt when I walked--walked like a very old person.  Don't take it!
Joint pain and weight gain. The joint pain stopped after I stopped taking the drug, but I haven't been able to get the weight off.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Nothing helped. But 6 days after I quit taking it most of the horrendous side effects went away.
userStories.indication: I was taking it as an anti-estrogen to inhibit re-occurence of cancer.

off-label_indications.indication: locally advanced disease in postmenopausal women. Breast cancer
Postmenopausal women at high risk; Prophylaxis

userStories.tip: I had invasive lobular carcinoma four years ago.  I'm post menopausal and my doctor put me on all three aramatose inhibitors to see if I could tolerate it.  Within a month I really did age 25 years. Every joint hurt, I was tired.

labeled_indications.indication: following 2 to 3 years of adjuvant tamoxifen Breast cancer

off-label_indications.indication: in postmenopausal women at increased risk; Prophylaxis  Breast cancer

carousel_items: Herceptin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the infusion. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure, difficulty breathing, or swelling usually happen within the first 24 hours.
Can cause heart problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have shortness of breath (especially at night), swelling in your arms or legs, or a cough that's new or worse.
Can cause lung problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have trouble breathing, shortness of breath, or a cough that's new or worse.
Only used for specific types of breast and stomach cancer. You'll have to take a test first to determine if Herceptin is the right medicine for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Herceptin is a monoclonal antibody. It stops tumor growth by inhibiting a specific protein in cancer cells.
basics.bottom_line: Herceptin is an effective, first-line option when used together with other medicines for certain types of breast and stomach cancers, but it has many side effects and needs a lot of monitoring.
downsides: Not the best choice if you have heart, kidney, or lung problems.
Your heart function will have to be checked regularly while you're taking Herceptin. This will be done before, during, and after treatment.

Herceptin can cause birth defects. Birth control is recommended while you're taking Herceptin and for 6 months after you finish. Talk to your doctor before starting Herceptin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice if you have heart, kidney, or lung problems.
Your heart function will have to be checked regularly while you're taking Herceptin. This will be done before, during, and after treatment.

Herceptin can cause birth defects. Birth control is recommended while you're taking Herceptin and for 6 months after you finish. Talk to your doctor before starting Herceptin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

upsides: Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can improve response and lower relapse in people with a certain type of breast cancer.
Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can increase the chance of living longer in people with a certain type of stomach cancer.
Treats breast and stomach cancer in people whose tumor has an excess of a specific protein (HER2).
First-line treatment option when used with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines for certain metastatic breast and stomach cancers.

upsides_processed.orig: Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can improve response and lower relapse in people with a certain type of breast cancer.
Taking Herceptin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines can increase the chance of living longer in people with a certain type of stomach cancer.
Treats breast and stomach cancer in people whose tumor has an excess of a specific protein (HER2).
First-line treatment option when used with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines for certain metastatic breast and stomach cancers.

drugs.name: Herceptin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Herceptin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the infusion. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure, difficulty breathing, or swelling usually happen within the first 24 hours.
Can cause heart problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have shortness of breath (especially at night), swelling in your arms or legs, or a cough that's new or worse.
Can cause lung problems. Talk to your doctor right away if you have trouble breathing, shortness of breath, or a cough that's new or worse.
Only used for specific types of breast and stomach cancer. You'll have to take a test first to determine if Herceptin is the right medicine for you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Herceptin can increase your risk of heart failure. Heart tests may be required before starting treatment, during treatment, and after finishing treatment.

description_processed.orig: Herceptin can increase your risk of heart failure. Heart tests may be required before starting treatment, during treatment, and after finishing treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Herceptin has been reported to cause serious and deadly infusion reactions and lung damage. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure or difficulty breathing, usually occur within 24 hours of receiving Herceptin. Your doctor may consider stopping Herceptin if you develop hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing), angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives) or acute respiratory distress syndrome (lung condition that lowers oxygen in the blood).

description_processed.orig: Herceptin has been reported to cause serious and deadly infusion reactions and lung damage. Symptoms, such as low blood pressure or difficulty breathing, usually occur within 24 hours of receiving Herceptin. Your doctor may consider stopping Herceptin if you develop hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing), angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives) or acute respiratory distress syndrome (lung condition that lowers oxygen in the blood).

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Herceptin may cause birth defects or death to a fetus. Don't use Herceptin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Herceptin may cause birth defects or death to a fetus. Don't use Herceptin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Herceptin can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Herceptin can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

carousel_items: Avastin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the first infusion.
Your blood pressure may go up while you're taking Avastin. Check your blood pressure regularly (every 2 to 3 weeks) and talk to your doctor if there are any changes.
You may bleed more easily while you're taking Avastin. Be careful and watch for unusual bleeding or bleeding that doesn't stop easily.
If you're a female, you should avoid getting pregnant while taking Avastin and for at least 6 months after you stop taking it.
Talk to your doctor before getting a vaccine. While you're taking Avastin, the vaccine may not work as well or you might increase your chance of getting sick.

basics.benefits_moa: Avastin is a monoclonal antibody. It binds to an important factor that blocks the blood supply to a tumor and stops the growth of cancer.
basics.bottom_line: Avastin is an effective, first-line option when used together with other medicines for certain types of cancers, but it has to be given in a clinic or hospital and it has many severe side effects.
downsides: Not the best choice if you have heart or kidney problems.
Avastin can damage the ovaries. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
It may take longer for you to heal. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice if you have heart or kidney problems.
Avastin can damage the ovaries. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.
It may take longer for you to heal. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery.
There's no generic available and it can be very expensive.

upsides: In studies, taking Avastin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines extended the lives of people with certain types of cancers better than not taking Avastin.
Treats brain, cervical, colorectal, lung, and kidney cancers.
Avastin is used as a first- or second-line choice along with other medicines for certain types of cancers.
Avastin is typically given every 2 to 3 weeks and can be given along with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines during the same visit.

upsides_processed.orig: In studies, taking Avastin with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines extended the lives of people with certain types of cancers better than not taking Avastin.
Treats brain, cervical, colorectal, lung, and kidney cancers.
Avastin is used as a first- or second-line choice along with other medicines for certain types of cancers.
Avastin is typically given every 2 to 3 weeks and can be given along with other chemotherapy (anti-cancer) medicines during the same visit.

drugs.name: Avastin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Avastin is a medicine that’s infused into your veins (intravenous infusion) in a clinic or hospital.
You’ll need to be watched in case you have a serious reaction during the first infusion.
Your blood pressure may go up while you're taking Avastin. Check your blood pressure regularly (every 2 to 3 weeks) and talk to your doctor if there are any changes.
You may bleed more easily while you're taking Avastin. Be careful and watch for unusual bleeding or bleeding that doesn't stop easily.
If you're a female, you should avoid getting pregnant while taking Avastin and for at least 6 months after you stop taking it.
Talk to your doctor before getting a vaccine. While you're taking Avastin, the vaccine may not work as well or you might increase your chance of getting sick.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach or intestine damage
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

risks_warnings.title: Lower wound healing
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can lower your ability to heal from a wound, especially from surgery. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery, and until the surgical wound is fully healed.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can lower your ability to heal from a wound, especially from surgery. Avastin shouldn't be used for 28 days before and after surgery, and until the surgical wound is fully healed.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause severe or fatal bleeding in the brain, nose, stomach, and vagina, and may also cause coughing up blood. Avastin can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause severe or fatal bleeding in the brain, nose, stomach, and vagina, and may also cause coughing up blood. Avastin can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can increase your risk for heart failure. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of cardiovascular disease.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can increase your risk for heart failure. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of cardiovascular disease.

risks_warnings.title: Ovary damage
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause ovarian failure in premenopausal women. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause ovarian failure in premenopausal women. Talk to your doctor before starting Avastin if you're concerned about getting pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: Avastin can cause kidney problems due to too much protein in your urine. Talk to your doctor about getting regular kidney tests while taking Avastin.

description_processed.orig: Avastin can cause kidney problems due to too much protein in your urine. Talk to your doctor about getting regular kidney tests while taking Avastin.

carousel_items: The lowest possible dose of corticosteroids should be used to control your symptoms.
When reducing or stopping the dose, do it very slowly and follow your doctor's instructions exactly to prevent major health emergencies.
If you used Dexamethasone for a long time, you could get withdrawal symptoms like muscle pain, joint pain, and malaise.
Some people gain weight while taking Dexamethasone or can experience other side effects like mood changes.
Don't get live or live/attenuated vaccines while on this. Killed or inactivated vaccines are fine.

basics.benefits_moa: Dexamethasone is a short-acting corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation by preventing your capillaries (small blood vessels) from leaking out excess fluid and chemicals that cause swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Dexamethasone is identical to an essential hormone that humans produce and has been proven to work safely.
downsides: Can't be used on its own to treat low cortisol levels.
Since it suppresses your immune system, you're more likely to get infections.
You can't take Dexamethasone if you have a systemic fungal infection.
Shouldn't be used if you have a stomach ulcer.
Can decrease bone formation and lead to an increased risk of osteoporosis.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used on its own to treat low cortisol levels.
Since it suppresses your immune system, you're more likely to get infections.
You can't take Dexamethasone if you have a systemic fungal infection.
Shouldn't be used if you have a stomach ulcer.
Can decrease bone formation and lead to an increased risk of osteoporosis.

upsides: Treats a large variety of inflammatory disorders including asthma, dermatitis, drug reactions, rashes, and endocrine disorders.
Can help prevent nausea, especially when it's caused by chemotherapy.
You can get it orally or as an injection.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats a large variety of inflammatory disorders including asthma, dermatitis, drug reactions, rashes, and endocrine disorders.
Can help prevent nausea, especially when it's caused by chemotherapy.
You can get it orally or as an injection.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers inflammation and suppresses your immune system.
drugs.name: dexamethasone

off-label_indications.indication: Prevention of nausea and vomiting from chemotherapy

carousel_items_processed.orig: The lowest possible dose of corticosteroids should be used to control your symptoms.
When reducing or stopping the dose, do it very slowly and follow your doctor's instructions exactly to prevent major health emergencies.
If you used Dexamethasone for a long time, you could get withdrawal symptoms like muscle pain, joint pain, and malaise.
Some people gain weight while taking Dexamethasone or can experience other side effects like mood changes.
Don't get live or live/attenuated vaccines while on this. Killed or inactivated vaccines are fine.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Dexamethasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Dexamethasone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Dexamethasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Dexamethasone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Dexamethasone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Dexamethasone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Dexamethasone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Dexamethasone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Dexamethasone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Dexamethasone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Dexamethasone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Dexamethasone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Dexamethasone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Dexamethasone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Mood and behavior changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Dexamethasone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Dexamethasone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Dexamethasone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Dexamethasone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Dexamethasone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

description_processed.orig: Taking Dexamethasone if you're pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma).

Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
May supress reactions to skin tests
Burning or tingling in perineal area
Increased requirements for insulin or oral agents
Negative nitrogen balance due to protein catabolism
Weight gain

carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

basics.benefits_moa: Medrol is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Medrol is corticosteroid available in many forms (oral, injectable) that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

downsides_processed.orig: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Useful in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.
Available in many different forms, including injection, that will expose the rest of your body less of the medicine.

upsides_processed.orig: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Useful in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.
Available in many different forms, including injection, that will expose the rest of your body less of the medicine.

Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.

Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.

risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Medrol too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Medrol dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Medrol for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Medrol and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Medrol for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Medrol and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Medrol may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Medrol may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Medrol may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Medrol may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Medrol to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Taking Medrol if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Medrol to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Medrol with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

description_processed.orig: Taking Medrol increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Medrol for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Medrol. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Medrol for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Medrol. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

points.name: Congestive heart failure in susceptible patients
Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
Peptic ulcer with possible perforation and hemorrhage
Increases ALT, SGPT, AST, SGOT, and alkaline phosphatase
May suppress reactions to skin tests
Increased requirements of insulin or oral hypoglycemic agents in diabetics

carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

clock.tip: Works better if taken with a high-fat meal.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful for many conditions.
Short-term use in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Long-term use in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.

userStories.tip: I have taken Prednisone on and off as low dose therapy to control Lupus and MS, but it caused a sandpaper rash all over my arms and face so doctor terminated the treatment. Weight gain was a definite issue for me.
Made my foot cramp and fall asleep. Also blurred vision!

SO SO hard to come off of...autoimmune chronic inflammatory issue--the rebound effect is vicious, and coming off prednisone makes me suicidal and want to self harm. Staying on prednisone makes me retain water and become hyper irritable.
Makes me aggressive
Caused weight loss, muscle wasting and thinning of the bones
Increases appetite..be aware
Weight gain
Never take on an empty stomach. Take the lowest dosage that is effective.
It has many more side effects than it's worth.. : /

userStories.identifier: Parent, work out when I can

drugs.name: Prednisone

labeled_indications.indication: Cerebral edema from a brain tumor or head injury

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

carousel_items: The dose of Provera will be different depending on what you’re using it for, so take it exactly the way your doctor tells you.
Talk to your doctor every few months about using the lowest possible dose of Provera. Since there can be a lot of long-term side effects, take it only as long as you need it.
Can cause headache, weight gain, breast tenderness, or changes in mood.
If you're taking Provera to regulate your period, you'll get withdrawal bleeding 3 to 7 days after stopping Provera.

basics.benefits_moa: Provera contains medroxyprogesterone, a progesterone hormone that works to balance hormone changes in the body. In premenopausal women, it prevents thickening of the uterus lining and regulates your menstrual cycle. It's also added to hormone therapy to protect the uterus from the harmful effects of estrogen.
basics.bottom_line: Provera works well to regulate your menstrual cycle and stop irregular bleeding. It also protects the uterus from estrogen's harmful effects.
downsides: You can't take Provera if you've had a hysterectomy (your uterus removed). You also can't take it if you're pregnant or breastfeeding, have unusual vaginal bleeding, or have a history of blood clots, certain kinds of cancer, stroke, heart attack, liver problems, or bleeding problems.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't take Provera if you've had a hysterectomy (your uterus removed). You also can't take it if you're pregnant or breastfeeding, have unusual vaginal bleeding, or have a history of blood clots, certain kinds of cancer, stroke, heart attack, liver problems, or bleeding problems.

upsides: Provera can be used to treat multiple hormone problems in women.

After menopause, taking estrogen raises your risk of uterine cancer. However, taking progesterone, like in Provera, along with estrogen gives you the positive effects of estrogen, but also prevents it from damaging your uterus.
Women taking an estrogen/progestin combination medications have a lower risk of uterine cancer.

upsides_processed.orig: Provera can be used to treat multiple hormone problems in women.

After menopause, taking estrogen raises your risk of uterine cancer. However, taking progesterone, like in Provera, along with estrogen gives you the positive effects of estrogen, but also prevents it from damaging your uterus.
Women taking an estrogen/progestin combination medications have a lower risk of uterine cancer.

drugs.one_liner: Regulates your menstrual cycle and supplements estrogen treatments for menopause.

userStories.tip: Many sources said it would stop your period completely. After a year, I experience light to moderate bleeding for almost a month before my next shot.

drugs.name: Provera

labeled_indications.indication: Prevention of uterine cancer in women taking estrogen

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose of Provera will be different depending on what you’re using it for, so take it exactly the way your doctor tells you.
Talk to your doctor every few months about using the lowest possible dose of Provera. Since there can be a lot of long-term side effects, take it only as long as you need it.
Can cause headache, weight gain, breast tenderness, or changes in mood.
If you're taking Provera to regulate your period, you'll get withdrawal bleeding 3 to 7 days after stopping Provera.

risks_warnings.title: Breast cancer
risks_warnings.description: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Provera, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of breast cancer

description_processed.orig: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Provera, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.

risks_warnings.title: Ovarian cancer
risks_warnings.description: Provera contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

description_processed.orig: Provera contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of blood clots and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of blood clots

description_processed.orig: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.

risks_warnings.title: Depression
risks_warnings.description: Provera can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Provera.

description_processed.orig: Provera can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Provera.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Provera is metabolized (broken down) by the liver, so if the liver is damaged, the drug can build up in your body. Stop taking Provera if you notice sudden yellowing of your skin or eyes. Don't start taking it if you have abnormal liver blood tests or a history of liver problems.

description_processed.orig: Provera is metabolized (broken down) by the liver, so if the liver is damaged, the drug can build up in your body. Stop taking Provera if you notice sudden yellowing of your skin or eyes. Don't start taking it if you have abnormal liver blood tests or a history of liver problems.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: You need to be sure you're not pregnant before using Provera since it can harm an unborn baby. Tell your doctor right away if you become pregnant.

description_processed.orig: You need to be sure you're not pregnant before using Provera since it can harm an unborn baby. Tell your doctor right away if you become pregnant.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
